title: Ukraine should have 'courage of the white flag' for negotiation, says Pope
text: Pope Francis has said in an interview that Ukraine should have what he called the courage of the quotwhite flagquot and negotiate an end to the war with Russia that followed Moscow039s full-scale invasion two years ago and that has killed tens of thousandsFrancis made his comments in an interview recorded last month with Swiss broadcaster RSI well before Friday039s latest offer by Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan to host a summit between Ukraine and Russia to end the warErdogan made the fresh offer after a meeting in Istanbul with his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskiy Zelenskiy has said while he wants peace he will not give up any territoryThe Ukrainian leader039s own peace plan calls for the withdrawal of Russian troops from all of Ukraine and the restoration of its state borders The Kremlin has ruled out engaging in peace talks on terms set by KyivA spokesman for Zelenskiy did not immediately respond to a request for comment on the pope039s remarksIn the interview Francis was asked for his position on a debate between those who say Ukraine should give up as it has not been able to repel Russian forces and those who say doing so would legitimise actions by the strongest party The interviewer used the term quotwhite flagquot in the questionquotIt is one interpretation that is truequot Francis said according to an advance transcript of the interview and a partial video made available to Reuters on Saturday It is due to be broadcast on March 20 as part of a new cultural programmequotBut I think that the strongest one is the one who looks at the situation thinks about the people and has the courage of the white flag and negotiatesquot Francis said adding that talks should take place with the help of international powersquotThe word negotiate is a courageous word When you see that you are defeated that things are not going well you have to have the courage to negotiatequot Francis saidIt was believed to be the first time Francis has used terms such as quotwhite flagquot or quotdefeatedquot in discussing the Ukraine war although he has spoken in the past about the need for negotiationsIn a statement Vatican spokesman Matteo Bruni said the pope had picked up on the term quotwhite flagquot spoken by the interviewer and used it quotto indicate a stop to hostilities and a truce achieved with the courage of negotiationsquotLast year the 87-year-old pope sent a peace envoy Italian Cardinal Matteo Zuppi to Kyiv Moscow and Washington to sound out leaders in those countriesquotOne may feel shamequot Francis said about negotiating quotbut how many dead will it the war end up with One should negotiate in time find a country that can be a mediatorquot Francis said mentioning Turkey among the countries that had offeredquotDo not be ashamed of negotiating before things get worsequot said Francis who has made hundreds of appeals for what he calls quotmartyred Ukrainequot Asked if he was willing to mediate Francis said quotI am herequotIn another part of the interview speaking of the war between Israel and Hamas Francis said quotNegotiating is never a surrenderquotLast month Zelenskiy said that 31000 Ukrainian soldiers had been killed since the Russian invasion in February 2022 and that tens of thousands of civilians had been killed in the occupied areas of the countryPublished By Ajmal Published
